title: ZIRP Zombie Company Effect
context: Central banks hold interest rates near zero (ZIRP) for over a decade to stimulate economic growth. Cheap capital floods the market. Companies that would have failed under normal conditions survive on cheap debt and venture funding. These 'zombie companies' — firms that can't cover interest payments from operating income — consume capital, talent, and market share without creating sustainable value. When rates rise, the zombies die all at once, creating cascading failures across the economy.
hypothesis: Low interest rates stimulate economic growth and help businesses thrive.

chain.root: Maintain near-zero interest rates for extended period

effects.label: Unprofitable companies survive on cheap capital
effects.impact: Zombie company share rises from 6% to 15-20% of public firms

children.label: Companies optimize for growth metrics, not profitability
Burn rates normalized — losing $100M/year becomes acceptable
Unit economics ignored because capital is essentially free

effects.label: Talent and resources misallocated to unsustainable businesses
effects.impact: Millions of workers in companies with no path to profitability

children.label: Engineers building products that will never generate sustainable revenue
Salary inflation driven by companies competing with free money
Productive companies can't compete for talent against subsidized competitors

effects.label: Asset bubbles inflate across all categories
effects.impact: Real estate, equities, crypto, venture all inflate simultaneously

children.label: Housing becomes unaffordable for median-income workers
Wealth inequality accelerates — asset owners benefit, workers don't

effects.label: Rate normalization triggers mass extinction event
effects.impact: 2022-2024: mass layoffs, startup failures, bank collapses

children.label: SVB collapse — concentrated exposure to rate-sensitive assets
Tech layoffs of 400K+ workers in 18 months
Venture funding drops 50-70% — zombie companies can't raise

dontIf: You're building a company that depends on perpetually cheap capital to survive
Your business model only works at zero interest rates
ifYouMust: Build for profitability from day one — don't assume cheap capital is permanent
Stress-test your business model at 5-7% interest rates
Maintain 18-24 months of runway regardless of fundraising climate
Focus on unit economics, not just growth metrics

alternatives.name: Bootstrapping
alternatives.note: Build a profitable business without external capital — immune to rate cycles

alternatives.name: Revenue-based financing
alternatives.note: Borrow against actual revenue, not projected growth — aligns incentives

alternatives.name: Capital-efficient growth
alternatives.note: Grow at the rate your revenue supports — sustainable by definition

sources.title: Federal Reserve: Financial Stability Report
sources.note: Analysis of how low rates enabled excessive risk-taking and leverage across the financial system

sources.note: Venture funding dropped 50%+ from 2021 peak as rates normalized

sources.title: Layoffs.fyi: Tech Layoff Tracker
sources.note: Comprehensive tracker showing 400K+ tech layoffs in 2022-2024, concentrated in ZIRP-era companies

falsifiability: Zombie companies created during ZIRP become profitable and sustainable at normal interest rates within 3 years
Low interest rate periods do not correlate with increased zombie company formation across multiple economic cycles
Rate normalization does not trigger disproportionate failures among companies funded during low-rate periods

seo.description: ZIRP tripled zombie company share to 15-20% of public firms. When rates normalized: 400K+ tech layoffs, 50% venture funding collapse, and SVB's failure. Cheap capital creates fragile economies.
